compose.question: What is Jetpack Compose?
compose.short_answer: Modern declarative UI toolkit for Android that uses Kotlin functions to build UI

compose.question: What is a Composable function?
compose.short_answer: Function annotated with @Composable that describes UI

compose.question: What does remember do?
compose.short_answer: Caches/preserves a value across recompositions

compose.question: What is mutableStateOf?
compose.short_answer: Creates observable state that triggers recomposition
compose.look_for: Can explain what triggers a recomposition

android.question: Name main Activity lifecycle methods
android.short_answer: onCreate, onStart, onResume, onPause, onStop, onDestroy

android.question: What happens when you rotate screen?
android.short_answer: Activity is destroyed and recreated with new configuration

android.question: What is an Intent?
android.short_answer: Messaging object to request action from another component

android.question: What is in AndroidManifest.xml?
android.short_answer: Declares components, permissions, features, metadata

kotlin.question: val vs var difference?
kotlin.short_answer: val is immutable (read-only), var is mutable

kotlin.question: Explain Kotlin null safety
kotlin.short_answer: Type system forces nullable types with ?

kotlin.question: What are safe call and Elvis operators?
kotlin.short_answer: ?. for safe calls, ?: for default when null

kotlin.question: What is a data class?
kotlin.short_answer: Class for data - generates equals, hashCode, toString, copy

kotlin.question: What are lambda expressions?
kotlin.short_answer: Anonymous functions passed as values - { param -> result }

kotlin.question: Difference between == and ===?
kotlin.short_answer: == checks structural equality, === checks referential equality

compose.question: What is Jetpack Compose?
compose.short_answer: Modern declarative UI toolkit for Android that uses Kotlin functions to build UI

compose.question: What is a Composable function?
compose.short_answer: Function annotated with @Composable that describes UI

compose.question: What does remember do?
compose.short_answer: Caches/preserves a value across recompositions

compose.question: What is mutableStateOf?
compose.short_answer: Creates observable state that triggers recomposition
compose.look_for: Can explain what triggers a recomposition

compose.question: What are Modifiers? Give examples.
compose.short_answer: Chainable decorators - padding, size, background, clickable

compose.question: Column vs LazyColumn difference?
compose.short_answer: Column renders all items, LazyColumn only renders visible items

compose.question: Explain State Hoisting
compose.short_answer: Moving state from child to parent to make child stateless

compose.question: What triggers recomposition?
compose.short_answer: When a State object that a composable reads changes

coroutines.question: What are coroutines?
coroutines.short_answer: Lightweight concurrent - suspend/resume without blocking threads

coroutines.question: Why use coroutines vs threads?
coroutines.short_answer: Much lighter, easier to write/read, structured concurrency

coroutines.question: What is a suspend function?
coroutines.short_answer: Function that can pause/resume without blocking
coroutines.look_for: Knows it can only be called from coroutine

coroutines.question: launch vs async difference?
coroutines.short_answer: launch returns Job (fire-and-forget), async returns Deferred

network.question: What is Retrofit?
network.short_answer: Type-safe REST client - HTTP API to interface

network.question: What HTTP methods do you know?
network.short_answer: GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE

network.question: How do you handle API errors?
network.short_answer: Try-catch, check response.isSuccessful, parse error body

network.question: What is JSON?
network.short_answer: JavaScript Object Notation - key-value data format

network.question: What is Room?
network.short_answer: SQLite abstraction layer - compile-time query verification

network.question: What is DataStore?
network.short_answer: Modern replacement for SharedPreferences

network.question: Room vs DataStore - when to use?
network.short_answer: Room for complex data, DataStore for settings

architecture.question: What is ViewModel?
architecture.short_answer: Holds UI data that survives config changes

architecture.question: Why use ViewModel vs Activity?
architecture.short_answer: Survives rotation, separates UI logic, testable

firebase.short_answer: NoSQL cloud DB with real-time sync

tools.short_answer: Version control system for tracking code changes

tools.short_answer: Debugger, Logcat, Layout Inspector, Network Inspector

tools.short_answer: Console showing logs and stack traces

tools.short_answer: Application Not Responding - blocks UI for 5+ seconds

project.question: Tell me about your RDA project (1-2 min)
How did your team collaborate? Git workflow?
What feature are you most proud of?

compose.question: What is Jetpack Compose?
compose.short_answer: Declarative UI toolkit for building Android interfaces using Kotlin code instead of XML layouts.
compose.look_for: Understands declarative vs imperative programming paradigm.

compose.question: What is a Composable function?
compose.short_answer: A function annotated with @Composable that describes UI elements and their behavior.
compose.look_for: Knows it's just a special function for UI composition.

compose.question: What does remember do?
compose.short_answer: Stores a value across recompositions so it doesn't reset when the UI redraws.
compose.look_for: Understands recomposition concept and state preservation.

compose.question: What is mutableStateOf?
compose.short_answer: Creates observable state that automatically triggers UI updates when the value changes.
compose.look_for: Connects state changes to UI updates and reactivity.

compose.question: What are Modifiers? Give examples.
compose.short_answer: Modifiers change how composables look and behave, such as padding, size, clickable, background, fillMaxWidth.
compose.look_for: Can give 2-3 real examples from actual usage.

compose.question: What's the difference between Column and LazyColumn?
compose.short_answer: Column loads all items immediately, LazyColumn only renders visible items for better performance with long lists.
compose.look_for: Understands lazy loading concept for performance optimization.

compose.question: Explain State Hoisting
compose.short_answer: Moving state management up to a parent composable and passing it down to children to make components reusable and testable.
compose.look_for: Understands making composables stateless and reusable.

compose.question: What triggers recomposition?
compose.short_answer: Changes to State values that are read during composition trigger recomposition of affected composables.
compose.look_for: Basic understanding of how Compose updates UI reactively.

android.question: Name the main Activity lifecycle methods
android.short_answer: onCreate, onStart, onResume, onPause, onStop, onDestroy define the activity lifecycle from creation to destruction.
android.look_for: Knows the basic flow and at least 4 methods in order.

android.question: What happens when you rotate the screen?
android.short_answer: The Activity is destroyed and recreated to handle the configuration change.
android.look_for: Understands configuration changes and their impact.

android.question: What is an Intent?
android.short_answer: A message object used to start activities, services, or send data between Android components.
android.look_for: Knows it's for navigation and inter-component communication.

android.question: What's in AndroidManifest.xml?
android.short_answer: App configuration including activities, permissions, app name, icon, minimum SDK version, and component declarations.
android.look_for: Basic awareness of app-level configuration requirements.

android.question: What are the four main app components?
android.short_answer: Activity (UI screens), Service (background tasks), BroadcastReceiver (system events), ContentProvider (data sharing).
android.look_for: Knows at least Activity and Service from practical usage.

android.question: What is Context?
android.short_answer: Interface to the application environment providing access to resources, databases, and system services.
android.look_for: Basic awareness even if used without deep understanding.

android.question: What is a Service?
android.short_answer: Component that performs long-running background operations without a user interface.
android.look_for: Understands distinction between background and foreground operations.

android.question: What is a BroadcastReceiver?
android.short_answer: Component that listens for and responds to system-wide broadcast events like battery low or network changes.
android.look_for: Basic awareness of system event handling.

kotlin.question: What's the difference between val and var?
kotlin.short_answer: val declares read-only (immutable) variables, var declares mutable variables that can be reassigned.
kotlin.look_for: Clear distinction and preference for val when possible.

kotlin.question: Explain Kotlin's null safety
kotlin.short_answer: Type system distinguishes nullable types (String?) from non-nullable types (String) to prevent null pointer exceptions at compile time.
kotlin.look_for: Understands how it prevents null pointer crashes.

kotlin.question: What are ?. and ?: operators?
kotlin.short_answer: ?. is the safe call operator (returns null if object is null), ?: is the Elvis operator (provides default value if null).
kotlin.look_for: Knows at least one and can explain its purpose.

kotlin.question: What is a data class?
kotlin.short_answer: A class primarily for holding data that automatically generates equals, hashCode, toString, and copy methods.
kotlin.look_for: Used for API responses, database entities, or models.

kotlin.question: What are lambda expressions?
kotlin.short_answer: Anonymous functions that can be passed as arguments, like onClick = { }, enabling functional programming patterns.
kotlin.look_for: Basic understanding of functional programming concepts.

kotlin.question: What's the difference between == and ===?
kotlin.short_answer: == checks structural equality (value comparison), === checks referential equality (same object instance).
kotlin.look_for: Knows the distinction between value and reference equality.

coroutines.question: What are coroutines?
coroutines.short_answer: Kotlin's lightweight concurrency framework for writing asynchronous code that doesn't block threads.

coroutines.question: Why use coroutines instead of threads?
coroutines.short_answer: Coroutines are lightweight, more readable, avoid callback hell, and make async code look synchronous.
coroutines.look_for: Some advantage mentioned like easier code or performance.

coroutines.question: What is a suspend function?
coroutines.short_answer: A function marked with suspend keyword that can pause execution and resume later, used within coroutines for async operations.
coroutines.look_for: Knows they used it for API calls and database operations.

coroutines.question: What's the difference between launch and async?
coroutines.short_answer: launch is fire-and-forget (returns Job), async returns a Deferred result that can be awaited.
coroutines.look_for: Basic distinction between the two coroutine builders.

coroutines.question: What are Dispatchers?
coroutines.short_answer: Determine which thread pool a coroutine runs on: Main (UI), IO (network/disk), Default (CPU-intensive).
coroutines.look_for: Knows at least Main and IO dispatchers from usage.

coroutines.question: Why can't you do network calls on Main thread?
coroutines.short_answer: Network calls block the UI thread causing the app to freeze and trigger ANR (Application Not Responding) errors.
coroutines.look_for: Understands blocking the UI thread is bad user experience.

coroutines.question: What is viewModelScope?
coroutines.short_answer: A CoroutineScope tied to ViewModel lifecycle that automatically cancels coroutines when ViewModel is cleared.
coroutines.look_for: Used it for launching coroutines in ViewModels.

network.question: What is Retrofit?
network.short_answer: Type-safe HTTP client library for making REST API calls in Android applications.
network.look_for: Actually used it in their project for API integration.

network.question: What HTTP methods do you know?
network.short_answer: GET (retrieve data), POST (create data), PUT (update data), DELETE (remove data), PATCH (partial update).
network.look_for: Knows at least GET and POST from practical usage.

network.question: How do you handle API errors?
network.short_answer: Use try-catch blocks around API calls, check response codes, parse error messages, and show user-friendly error messages.
network.look_for: Thought about error handling and user feedback.

network.question: What is JSON?
network.short_answer: JavaScript Object Notation, a lightweight text-based data format using key-value pairs for data exchange between client and server.
network.look_for: Basic awareness and usage in API communication.

network.question: What is Room?
network.short_answer: SQLite database abstraction library providing compile-time verification and easier database access for local data storage.
network.look_for: Used it or knows it's for offline/local data persistence.

network.question: What is DataStore?
network.short_answer: Modern replacement for SharedPreferences using coroutines and Flow for storing key-value pairs asynchronously.
network.look_for: Basic awareness of preferences storage solution.

network.question: Room vs DataStore - when to use which?
network.short_answer: Room for complex structured data with relationships and queries, DataStore for simple key-value preferences and settings.
network.look_for: Basic distinction between database and preferences.

architecture.question: What is ViewModel?
architecture.short_answer: Architecture component that holds and manages UI-related data in a lifecycle-conscious way, surviving configuration changes.
architecture.look_for: Knows it's separate from Activity/Composables for data management.

architecture.question: Why use ViewModel instead of Activity?
architecture.short_answer: ViewModel survives configuration changes like rotation, separates business logic from UI, and enables better testing.
architecture.look_for: Some benefit mentioned like surviving rotation or separation of concerns.

architecture.question: What is MVVM?
architecture.short_answer: Model-View-ViewModel architecture pattern where Model holds data, View displays UI, ViewModel connects them and holds UI logic.
architecture.look_for: Can explain the three layers and their responsibilities.

architecture.question: What is Repository pattern?
architecture.short_answer: Abstraction layer between ViewModel and data sources (API, database) that manages data operations and provides a clean API.
architecture.look_for: Knows it's for centralizing data management logic.

architecture.question: What is Dependency Injection?
architecture.short_answer: Design pattern where dependencies are provided from outside a class rather than created inside, improving testability and flexibility.
architecture.look_for: Basic concept understanding even if implementation is unclear.

architecture.question: What is Hilt?
architecture.short_answer: Dependency injection library built on Dagger for Android that reduces boilerplate code for DI setup.
architecture.look_for: Actually used it in their project for dependency management.

architecture.question: Why separate layers (ViewModel, Repository, etc.)?
architecture.short_answer: Better code organization, improved testability, reusability of components, and easier maintenance and collaboration.
architecture.look_for: Some benefit mentioned like testing or organization.

firebase.question: What Firebase services have you used?
firebase.short_answer: Firebase Authentication, Cloud Firestore, Cloud Storage, Cloud Messaging (Push Notifications), Analytics, or Crashlytics.
firebase.look_for: Actually implemented at least one service in a project.

firebase.question: What is Firebase Authentication?
firebase.short_answer: Service providing backend authentication supporting email/password, Google, Facebook, phone, and other authentication methods.
firebase.look_for: Implemented user login/signup in their project.

firebase.question: What is Firestore?
firebase.short_answer: Cloud-hosted NoSQL document database with real-time synchronization and offline support for mobile and web apps.
firebase.look_for: Used it for cloud data storage or knows real-time features.

tools.question: What is Git?
tools.short_answer: Distributed version control system for tracking code changes, collaborating with team members, and managing project history.
tools.look_for: Actually used it in team projects for version control.

tools.question: What is a git branch?
tools.short_answer: Independent line of development allowing multiple features or fixes to be worked on simultaneously without affecting main code.
tools.look_for: Used branches in project for feature development.

tools.question: What is Gradle?
tools.short_answer: Build automation tool that compiles code, manages dependencies, packages apps, and handles different build variants.
tools.look_for: Basic awareness of build system and dependency management.

tools.question: What debugging tools do you use?
tools.short_answer: Logcat for viewing logs, Debugger with breakpoints, Android Profiler, Layout Inspector, and Network Inspector.
tools.look_for: Actually used at least Logcat and debugger for troubleshooting.

tools.question: What is Logcat?
tools.short_answer: Android Studio console that displays system logs, app logs, error messages, and debug information in real-time.
tools.look_for: Used it regularly for debugging and error tracking.

tools.question: What is ANR?
tools.short_answer: Application Not Responding error that occurs when the UI thread is blocked for more than 5 seconds, freezing the app.
tools.look_for: Awareness of the concept and avoiding blocking operations.

project.question: Tell me about your RDA project in 1 minute
project.look_for: Can explain clearly, mentions key features like check-in/out and attendance tracking.

project.question: What was YOUR specific role and contribution?
project.look_for: Distinguishes their work from teammates, honest about individual contribution.

project.question: What was the hardest part of building the app?
project.look_for: Specific technical challenge mentioned, shows real problem-solving approach.

project.question: What technologies did you use? (Let them list)
project.look_for: Can recall main technologies: Kotlin, Compose, Retrofit, Room/Firestore, MVVM, Hilt.

project.question: How did you handle check-in/check-out functionality?
project.look_for: GPS location, timestamp, API calls, basic understanding of the flow.

project.question: How did your team collaborate? Git workflow?
project.look_for: Branching strategy, pull requests, code review awareness and practice.

project.question: What would you do differently if you rebuilt it?
project.look_for: Self-reflection, learning from experience, identifies specific improvements.

project.question: What feature are you most proud of?
project.look_for: Shows ownership, enthusiasm about their work, technical details mentioned.
